text: prior to coming to HBS I had just
finished a dual masters between Columbia
and the London School of Economics and
public policy
I got my masters at Columbia Journalism
school and then I worked at Fortune
magazine before coming here I was an
undergrad and I was majoring in
psychology specifically social
psychology at the University of British
Columbia I used to work for the Central
Bank of Pakistan as a lead economist I
was responsible for analyzing financial
markets I finished my master's degree at
the Fletcher School and I focused on
global political economy and development
economics
I graduated from Wellesley College where
I studied economics and after graduation
I started a job here as a research
associate
I think it's a great position for anyone
who is intellectually curious who is
just generally very excited about
research I think my interests have
really changed I'd encourage everyone to
apply this is a fabulous job the
work-life balance is incredibly sane yet
the opportunities that you get are again
second to none because you get a
front-row seat to seeing how the
business world is formed the new ideas
and what the next generation is going to
think and it all starts here and you get
to be a part of that
out of the more than hundred research
associates on campus I would say we have
almost five generations working at HBS
at any point of time we've had some
experiences where people have come in
from private equity and banking and then
decided that oh my god this is really
exciting research and I want to actually
be an economist when I first applied for
this job
HR told me that one of the best things
that happens is your relationship with a
faculty member and I thought all right
sure but I wasn't really expecting much
they were right my boss and my
relationship with her is one of the best
things about this job and there is so
much I've learned from her as a business
leader and just as a person you will
really enjoy this job if you like going
down different pathways if you're not
willing to accept the first answer if
you think Google is not really the only
way to find data this is a job for
people who like to go after detail
although HBS from the outside seems like
a very big scary place once you get in
those doors it really is like a
wonderful environment all the people
I've met are so supportive you know
we're always laughing in the hallways
and everyone I meet is just so fun and
not only do I get wonderful research
experience I get to have a lot of fun
while I'm doing it and I've met
wonderful people who will support me I
think going into doctoral programs as
well so I feel very grateful for this
opportunity
you
